comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: See www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2448657535/ The two pictures give the guy different surnames: Bryant is right. See NYT article at query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9C0DE4DC1E3AE633A... MME. NAZIMOVA MARRIES.; Actress Weds Charles E. Bryant, Her Leading Man in "Bella Donna." December 6, 1912, Friday In the presence of only a few intimate friends, Mme. Alla Nazimova and her leading man, Charles E. Bryant, were wedded at 5 o'clock yesterday afternoon in the apartments of the actress at 10 West Fortieth Street. The wedding was kept a secret, but the fact became known and the other members of the company playing in "Bella Donna" at the Empire Theatre showered congratulations upon the pair when they appeared at the evening performance. --- I imagine the photo is a promotional photo, presumably for 'Bella Donna' since the NYT piece indicates that he played a doctor.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: There seems to be some doubt as to whether they were legally married. Some sources say they were divorced in 1925.
